newsitem.title: UK: ACI sets provisional programme for Toronto Forex.
newsitem.headline: ACI sets provisional programme for Toronto Forex.

text.p: The Association Cambiste Internationale (ACI) has set out the provisional programme for its 39th annual congress in Toronto on May 29-31.

The planned keynote speaker is Bank of Canada Governor Gordon Thiessen, who on Friday May 30 will deliver a speech, "How well are exchange rates working? A Canadian perspective" which will be followed by a question and answer session.
Following Thiessen, Bill McDonough, President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York will present "The case for price stability," also followed by a Q and A.
South African Reserve Bank Governor Chris Stals will speak on "South Africa - Opportunities and Concerns"

Other planned speakers include Mikio Wakatshuki, Chairman of the Board of Counsellors at the Japan Research Institute, Rudi Dornbusch, Professor of Economics at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Jean Monty, President and CEO of Northern Telecom Limited.
